problem_text:
Does there exist an absolute constant c such that any finite p-group P has an
abelian section A satisfying |A|c > |P|?
By a result of A. Yu. Olshanskii (Math. Notes, 23 (1978), 183–185) we cannot
require A to be a subgroup. By a result of J. G. Thompson (J. Algebra, 13 (1969),
149–151) the existence of such a section A would imply the existence of a class 2
subgroup H of P with |H|c > |P|.
L. Pyber
